Line 13: Line 13:
In August 2006, Morton announced a [[United States Dollar|$]]30 million bid for the naming rights to the [[Arizona Cardinals]]' new [[University of Phoenix Stadium|stadium]] in [[Glendale, Arizona]].<ref>Villalobos, Louie. "[http://www.azcentral.com/sports/special5/articles/0821stadium21-ON.html Pink Taco's owners make bid to name Cards stadium]." ''[[Arizona Republic]].'' August 21, 2006. Retrieved on August 21, 2006.</ref> The offer was rejected by the Cardinals, who dismissed the announcement as a joke and a publicity stunt. On September 28, 2006, Pink Taco launched a similar bid to rename the [[Louisiana Superdome]] in [[New Orleans]] to the "Pink Taco Dome". As the State of Louisiana owns the Superdome, any name change must be approved by the [[Louisiana State Legislature]].<ref>Mackel, Fletcher. "[http://news.yahoo.com/s/wdsu/20060929/lo_wdsu/9956336 Pink Taco Wants Naming Rights to Superdome]." ''[[WDSU]].'' September 28, 2006. Retrieved on September 29, 2006.</ref>
In August 2006, Morton announced a [[United States Dollar|$]]30 million bid for the naming rights to the [[Arizona Cardinals]]' new [[University of Phoenix Stadium|stadium]] in [[Glendale, Arizona]].<ref>Villalobos, Louie. "[http://www.azcentral.com/sports/special5/articles/0821stadium21-ON.html Pink Taco's owners make bid to name Cards stadium]." ''[[Arizona Republic]].'' August 21, 2006. Retrieved on August 21, 2006.</ref> The offer was rejected by the Cardinals, who dismissed the announcement as a joke and a publicity stunt. On September 28, 2006, Pink Taco launched a similar bid to rename the [[Louisiana Superdome]] in [[New Orleans]] to the "Pink Taco Dome". As the State of Louisiana owns the Superdome, any name change must be approved by the [[Louisiana State Legislature]].<ref>Mackel, Fletcher. "[http://news.yahoo.com/s/wdsu/20060929/lo_wdsu/9956336 Pink Taco Wants Naming Rights to Superdome]." ''[[WDSU]].'' September 28, 2006. Retrieved on September 29, 2006.</ref>

==Live animal controversy==
  +
On May 5, 2011 in honor of Cinco de Mayo the Pink Taco in Century City, CA painted a donkey pink and wrote "Pink Taco" on both its sides. Critics claimed the donkey was shaved, painted pink and left outside in 90 Â°[[Fahrenheit|F]] heat. Spokesman for the animal rental company said the animal was treated fairly and two trainers were on site to care for it. The restaurant manager refused to comment. <ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.ktla.com/news/landing/ktla-pink-taco-donkey-outrage,0,7749811.story |title=Pink Taco Restaurant: Angry Community Members Call for Boycott Over Pink Taco's Pink Donkey Display for Cinco de Mayo - ktla.com |author=klta news|work=ktla.com |year=2011 |accessdate=9 May 2011}}</ref>
